Dear Ana McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. You must contest or agree to the
issuance of a provisional license in writing, on the CWL-4617 within 15 days, with
submission of the corrective action plan. If you do not submit the CWL-4617, it will be
treated as contested. Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must
still submit an acceptable corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis
Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title & (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Section policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/26/24, youth assaulted a staff, who hit the youth back when
defending themselves. The youth has a quarter sized abrasion on
the right cheek and a broken and bleeding nail bed on one hand.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
All interviews below, except Staff 3, were conducted
individually face to face on 10/29/24 at the facility in
coordination with MDHHS Worker.
Complainant reported when she spoke with Staff 1 about the
incident alleged in the complaint, Staff 1 stated she felt
unsupported by other staff present during the situation.
Youth A reported she was coming out of the TV room, and she
asked Staff 1 if she could call her mom because she was having a
bad day and calling her mom is one of her known and
documented coping skills. Youth A reported Staff 1 said she had a
problem with Youth A’s shirt because it wasn’t covering her butt,
and Staff 1 told Youth A to go change. Youth A reported she
asked Staff 1 if she could call her mom first because she was
struggling, and Youth A agreed to change her shirt after she called
her mom. Staff 1 told Youth A she couldn’t call her mom until she
changed her shirt. Youth A reported she told Staff 1 they weren’t
leaving the unit until later and agreed to change her shirt before
she left the unit, but again requested the ability to call her mom
first. Youth A reported Staff 1 had an evident attitude towards her,
and Youth A was very frustrated, so she repeatedly asked Staff 1
to stop talking to her, but Staff 1 wouldn’t stop. Youth A reported
Staff 2 was in the kitchen and said she would allow Youth A to call
her mom, but Staff 1 intervened and said no one could call Youth
A’s mom until Youth A changed her shirt. Youth A reported she
again asked Staff 1 to stop talking to her, but Staff 1 said, “I don’t
have to stop. I can talk to you any way I want”. Youth A reported
she was trying to walk away, but Staff 1 continued to talk to her.
Youth A reported she asked Staff 1 approximately 4-6 more times
2

to stop talking to her, but Staff 1 continued and wouldn’t back
down.
Youth A reported Staff 2 tried to intervene and told Staff 1 to stop
talking to Youth A, but Staff 1 still wouldn’t stop. Youth A reported
Staff 2 was trying to de-escalate the situation, but Staff 1 was
making no efforts to do so.
Youth A reported she picked up a lotion bottle and threw it at Staff
1 intending to hit her, but the bottle didn’t hit Staff 1. Staff 1 said,
“little girl, don’t throw anything at me”. Youth A reported she got in
Staff 1’s face and told her to stop talking to her again, but Staff 1
still wouldn’t stop. Staff 1 pushed Youth A and said, “get out of my
face”. Youth A reported she then pushed Staff 1 twice and
punched Staff 1 in her face. Youth A reported Staff 1 retaliated
and was punching her as well as pulling her hair. Youth A reported
Staff 1 also attempted to kick her in the stomach, but Staff 3
intervened and stopped it from happening. Youth A reported Staff
2 separated her and Staff 1, and Staff 1 went into the staff office.
Youth A reported as Staff 1 went into the office, she told Youth A
she was going to “get her people to come beat her up”. Youth A
reported she then ran into the staff office and began fighting with
Staff 1 again. Youth A reported she and Staff 1 were both
throwing punches at each other. Youth A reported Staff 3 got in
between them to separate them while Staff 2 was trying to verbally
de-escalate the situation. Youth A reported after they were
separated, Staff 4 brought her to the TV room to cool down. Youth
A reported she had a mark on her face, a bruise on the top of her
left forearm, a scratch on her hand, a scratch on her neck, and
two broken nails because of the altercation. Youth A reported her
neck is still sore because of Staff 1 pulling her hair.
Youth B reported she was in the milieu with Youth C and Youth D
watching a movie. Youth B reported Staff 1 came back from
working at another unit on campus, and started saying very
negative things such as “those girls on the other unit are more
respectful, have manners, and act better than all of you”. Youth B
reported she felt Staff 1 immediately put everyone in a bad mood
and was just trying to start stuff as soon as she walked onto the
milieu. Youth B reported if youth are off the unit, and they have
leggings on, they must have their bottoms covered; however, if
they are on the unit, they are allowed to wear leggings without
having their bottoms covered. Youth B reported after Staff 1 spoke
negatively towards them, she started to go around to each youth
who had leggings on and nitpicking their outfits, which made them
3

all upset because no other staff said anything to them about their
clothes all day.
Youth B reported Staff 1 went in front of the kitchen window and
began talking to Staff 2. Youth A came out of the TV room
requesting to call her mom. Youth B reported Staff 1 immediately
told Youth A she needed to put a longer shirt on since she had
leggings on, and she couldn’t call her mom until she did. Youth B
reported Youth A then asked Staff 2 if she could call her mom,
and Staff 1 intervened by saying “No [Staff 2], [Youth A] has to put
a longer shirt on”. Youth A told Staff 1 to stop talking to her and
Staff 1 said, “I don’t have to stop talking to you”. Youth B reported
Youth A threw a hair product bottle and tissue box at Staff 1 and
then got in Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 pushed Youth A and Youth A
pushed Staff 1 back. Youth B reported after they pushed each
other, Staff 1 and Youth A began punching each other, and pulling
each other’s hair. Youth B reported Staff 2 was trying to intervene
and break them up, and repeatedly told Staff 1 to walk away, but
Staff 1 would not walk away. Staff 1 eventually stated the reason
she couldn’t walk away was because Youth A had a hold of her
hair. Youth B reported after the fight went on for a bit, Staff 3 took
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D to their rooms, so they couldn’t see
what else happened.
Youth B reported if Staff 1 hadn’t come onto the unit with a bad
attitude and rude comments to begin with, it might have stopped
everything from escalating to the extent it did. Youth B reported
Youth A repeatedly asked Staff 1 to stop talking to her, and Staff 1
made no efforts to walk away, de-escalate the situation or back
down from her request for Youth A to change clothes.
Youth C reported Staff 1 came onto the unit bragging about how
the female youth on another unit were so much better behaved
and listened better than the girls on this unit. Youth C reported
Youth A asked Staff 1 if she could talk to her mom, but Staff 1 said
she wouldn’t make the call until Youth A changed her shirt. Youth
A told Staff 1 she wanted to talk to her mom because she was
having a bad day and needed to calm down, but Staff 1 still
wouldn’t allow her to call her mom. Youth C reported Staff 1
pushed Youth A, and Youth A pushed Staff 1 back and then
punched Staff 1. Youth C reported she didn’t see much after that
because Staff 3 put her, Youth B and Youth D in their rooms.
However, Youth C reported she could still hear some of what was
going on and she heard Staff 2 repeatedly telling Staff 1 to walk
away, and asked Staff 1 and Youth A to stop fighting.
4

Youth C reported all the youth in the facility have trauma, and
Staff 1 should have understood that, as well as the fact that she’s
an adult and should have worked to de-escalate the situation
rather than escalating it further. Youth C reported Staff 1 doesn’t
understand the youths’ needs or triggers, and she’s going to end
up creating more trauma for them. Youth C reported Staff 1 is a
bully, not a nice person, and argues with the youth all the time.
Youth D reported she was in the milieu braiding Youth C’s hair
when Staff 1 entered the unit and started bragging the female
youth on another unit were so much better than them. Youth D
reported Staff 1 said, “the girls on Riebel are so much better
behaved and more respectful than all of you”. Youth D reported
Staff 1’s comments immediately put everyone in a bad mood.
Youth D reported Staff 1 makes the environment more stressful
every time she works.
Youth D reported after Staff 1 made her comments, Youth A came
out of the TV room and asked Staff 1 if she could call her mom.
Youth D reported Staff 2 was in the kitchen making lunch and
Staff 3 was in the staff office completing trainings. Youth D
reported Staff 1 told her she couldn’t call her mom until she put on
a shirt that covered her bottom since she was wearing leggings.
Youth A explained to Staff 1 she was having a bad day and really
needed to call her mom but offered to change her clothes as soon
as the call was over. Youth D reported instead of compromising,
Staff 1 took the opportunity to nit-pick the shirt situation and
instigate the situation further. Youth D reported Youth A asked to
call her mom again and promised she would change her shirt after
the call, but Staff 1 continued to refuse. Youth A yelled and said,
“just let me call my mom!”. Youth D reported Staff 1 responded, “I
don’t know who you think you’re talking to. Put on a longer shirt”.
Youth D reported Youth A threw a tissue box and a hair product
bottle at Staff 1. Youth D reported Staff 1 took a step towards
Youth A, so Youth A got into Staff 1’s face and began yelling at
her. Youth D reported Staff 1 shoved Youth A, so Youth A shoved
Staff 1 back and punched her. Youth D reported Staff 1 began
returning punches, so both Staff 1 and Youth A were punching
each other. Youth D reported Staff 2 came out of the kitchen, told
them to stop and tried to intervene, while Staff 3 put Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth D in their rooms. Youth D reported she heard
a lot of yelling after she got into her room but couldn’t see what
else happened. Youth D reported Youth A has never put her
hands on a staff before, even when she’s angry. Youth D reported
Youth A has thrown objects, yelled, etc., but that’s it.
5

Staff 1 reported on Saturday 10/26/24, just before lunch, she
came onto the unit from another unit. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was
in the kitchen making lunch and Youth B, Youth C and Youth D
were in the milieu. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 asked her how Riebel
was, and Staff 1 told Staff 2 how sweet the girls on Riebel were.
Staff 1 reported she asked Staff 2 where Youth A was, and Staff 2
reported she was in the TV room. Staff 1 reported the youth were
dressed inappropriately. Staff 1 reported one youth’s shirt wasn’t
long enough, didn’t have straps and her pants were too tight, and
another youth had too short of a shirt on. Staff 1 reported she told
the youth in the milieu to change into more appropriate outfits and
they complied. Staff 1 reported she went to the TV room, knocked
on the door, and waved to Youth A. Staff 1 reported she went
back to the window to the kitchen and began talking to Staff 2
again. Staff 1 reported Youth A came into the milieu and was
talking to her so they could catch up. Staff 1 reported she noticed
Youth A was wearing a crop top sweater unzipped, with no shirt
underneath and tight yoga pants on. Staff 1 reported she told
Youth A she needed to put a shirt on underneath her sweater and
Youth A became very irritated because no other staff told her she
needed to change. Staff 1 reported initially, Youth A agreed to
changing, but then she turned around and asked to call her mom.
Staff 1 reported she told Youth A she would make the phone call
for her after Youth A changed her clothes, and Youth A agreed.
Staff 1 reported she didn’t know what happened after, but Youth A
became very antsy and then said she didn’t want to change her
shirt. Staff 1 reported she told Youth A she wouldn’t make the
phone call until Youth A changed her shirt. Staff 1 reported Youth
A then became aggressive. Staff 1 reported Youth A went to the
kitchen window and asked Staff 2 to make the phone call to her
mom. Staff 1 said, “we agreed you would put a shirt on and then I
would make your phone call because you’re not appropriately
dressed”. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 asked what was going on, so
she explained the situation to Staff 2. Staff 1 reported Youth A
said, “please stop talking to me”. Staff 1 reported she knew if a
youth says that, the expectation is for her to stop talking because
she learned that from licensing, so she stopped talking.
Staff 1 reported Youth A walked behind the staff desk in the milieu
and said, “shut the fuck up talking to me”. Staff 1 reported she
wasn’t talking to Youth A, so she wasn’t sure why Youth A said it.
Staff 1 reported she was going to let Youth A vent, but because
they have a good rapport, she felt she could address it. Staff 1
reported she said, “[Youth A] you’re not being safe right now and I
can’t make your phone call because I can’t get to the office”. Staff
6

1 reported Youth A threw two things at her and she blocked them.
Staff 1 reported Youth A said, “shut the fuck up. I’m about to hit
you”. Staff 1 reported Youth A charged at her, and hit her directly
in the eye, which caused her to lose vision. Staff 1 reported Youth
A got a hold of her hair, and Staff 1 told Staff 2 she couldn’t get
away from Youth A because Youth A had a hold of her hair. Staff
1 reported Staff 2 was standing next to them and wasn’t doing
anything to help or intervene. Staff 1 reported she was trying to
get Youth A’s hands off her hair and was yelling for someone to
get Youth A off her. Staff 1 reported she couldn’t remember how
she finally got away.
Staff 1 reported she tried to get to the staff office to call for help
because Staff 3 was in the staff office doing training. Staff 1
reported Youth A gripped her hair again in the front of the staff
office and Staff 1 was begging Youth A to let her go. Staff 1
reported she was trying to lean Youth A against the wall so she
could get away from Youth A and prevent Youth A from tearing
out anymore of her hair. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was yelling at
Youth A to get off Staff 1, but she wasn’t listening. Staff 1 reported
she was finally able to get away from Youth A and went into the
staff office. Staff 1 reported she called 911 while Youth A was
attacking her in the office. Staff 1 reported somehow, someone
(she didn’t know who) got Youth A out of the staff office. Staff 1
reported she called Supervisor 3 to notify her she was attacked
repeatedly by Youth A. Staff 1 reported while she was on the
phone, Youth A was still banging on the office door. Staff 1
reported she had a headache, her vision was blurry, she couldn’t
breathe, she had an asthma attack, and she was throwing up.
Staff 1 reported Staff 4 took Youth A to another part of the unit so
Staff 1 could come out of the office safely.
Staff 1 reported while Youth A was attacking her repeatedly, she
had to defend herself because no one was helping her. Staff 1
reported she never hit, punched, pulled hair or scratched Youth A.
Staff 1 reported she might have pushed Youth A in self-defense,
but that’s all she did. Staff 1 admitted she knew Youth A calling
her mom was one of her coping skills, but she didn’t feel like she
could safely call Youth A's mom because she couldn’t verify
whether she needed to monitor the call or not. Staff 1 reported she
didn’t walk away or leave the unit when things were escalating
because the ratio is 1 staff to 3 youth and Staff 3 did not count in
ratio because she was in training. Staff 1 reported she didn’t call
for help because Youth A was escalated by the office. Staff 1
reported she felt she could talk to Youth A, and she would calm
down because they have a good rapport. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
7

offered to call Youth A’s mom, but she never followed through.
Staff 1 reported she never told Youth A “no” to calling her mom.
Staff 1 reported she did not feel a power struggle occurred
because she doesn’t feel holding youth accountable to unit
expectations is a power struggle. Staff 1 reported she is always
going to follow the rules, and it was the other three staff over the
course of the day who didn’t follow the rules and address the
dress code with the youth.
Staff 2 reported she was working the morning shift on Saturday
and was making lunch. Staff 2 reported Youth A came to the
kitchen window and appeared agitated. Staff 2 reported Youth A
had come out of the TV room and asked to call her mom, but her
interaction with Staff 1 was confrontational on Staff 1’s part. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 made immediate comments about the length of
Youth A’s shirt. Staff 2 reported they enforce the policy more when
they go into the community, but it’s more relaxed on the unit. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 continued to make comments about the length
of Youth A’s shirt, and Youth A was getting more upset with each
comment. Staff 2 reported Youth A asked Staff 1 to stop talking to
her and leave her alone multiple times, but Staff 1 wouldn’t stop.
Staff 2 reported Youth A said she just wanted to make a call to her
mom, and Staff 1 told her she couldn’t make the call until she
changed her shirt. Staff 2 reported she overruled Staff 1 and said,
“give me a minute, and I’ll let you call your mom”. Staff 1 reported
she knew Youth A would calm down when she talked to her mom
and there was no reason Youth A couldn’t call her mom. Staff 2
reported no sooner than she was leaving the kitchen, she heard a
commotion in the milieu before she saw what was happening.
Staff 2 reported she heard Youth A using a lot of profanity and
saying, “I told you to get out of my fucking face. I told you to leave
me alone”. Staff 2 reported as she exited the kitchen, she saw
Youth A and Staff 1 having a full physical altercation where they
were both kicking, punching and pulling each other’s hair. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 was trying to get away but couldn’t because Youth
A had a hold of Staff 1’s hair. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 punched
Youth A 3-4 times in her upper body. Staff 2 reported she tried to
get in the middle of them to get them apart, but they wouldn’t
separate. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 was present, but she is not
AEGIS restraint trained, so she could not help with a physical
intervention. Staff 2 told Staff 3 to get the other youth into their
rooms to ensure their safety, so she did. Staff 2 reported Youth A
pulled some of Staff 1’s hair out, and Staff 1 was able to break
free and get into the staff office. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 called
8

Supervisor 3 and Staff 2 reported she called Staff 4 to request
assistance.
Staff 2 reported while she was checking on Staff 1 in the staff
office, Youth A entered the staff office and began hitting Staff 1
again. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 began hitting Youth A back again.
Staff 2 reported once again, she was trying to verbally de-escalate
the situation and get in the middle of Youth A and Staff 1 to
separate them. Staff 2 reported Youth A finally snapped out of it,
and left the office, so Staff 2 shut the staff office door and made
sure it was secure. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 called 911 while she
was in the office. Staff 2 reported even though Staff 3 could not
physically intervene by restraining Youth A, she could have
physically intervened by restraining Staff 1 to help separate them.
Staff 2 reported two of Youth A’s nails were broken and bleeding,
and she had a scratch on her face from Staff 1. Staff 2 reported
her main concern was Staff 1’s actions and verbal altercation with
Youth A that escalated the situation. Staff 2 reported she felt Staff
1 instigated the situation rather than de-escalating it. Staff 2
reported she has received multiple complaints from the youth
about Staff 1. Staff 2 reported the youth have told her Staff 1 is
demanding, authoritative, nit-picky, and does not treat them like
people. Staff 2 reported she notified Supervisor 3 of these
concerns previously. Staff 2 reported Youth A has made it very
clear with staff if they have a conversation with her rather than
talking at her, it helps reduce her anger, and this is something all
staff are aware of.
Supervisor 1 reported he was working as the evening campus
supervisor for support, and he received a call from Staff 5 asking if
he was on campus because Staff 1 got into a physical altercation
with Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported he arrived at the unit at the
same time the police were arriving. Supervisor 1 reported when he
entered the unit, Staff 2 and Staff 3 were talking to Youth A and
Staff 1 was in the staff office. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 4 took
Youth A off the unit, while Staff 1 went outside to speak with the
police. Supervisor 1 reported he retrieved Staff 1’s keys and put
her on leave because of the altercation, which she accepted with
no issues. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 was checked out by the
paramedics in the ambulance, while Supervisor 2 took Youth A to
the hospital to receive assessment and treatment.
Supervisor 2 reported she was the on-call supervisor on
10/26/24, and she received a call from Supervisor 3 notifying her
what was going on. Supervisor 2 reported when she arrived on
campus, the police and ambulance were present. Supervisor 2
9

reported she saw Staff 1 sitting in the police car and Staff 1 told
her she was assaulted. Supervisor 2 reported she saw Supervisor
1 and Supervisor 1 told her Staff 1 was put on administrative leave
due to the situation. Supervisor 2 reported she went on the unit,
which was a disaster. Supervisor 2 reported she went to talk to
Youth A, and saw Youth A was crying, her hands were bleeding,
she had hair pulled out (she had braids), and she had a couple
broken nails. Supervisor 2 reported she did a full injury check and
noticed there was bleeding scratch on Youth A’s face, and another
one on her neck. Supervisor 2 took Youth A to the hospital to
address her injuries.
Supervisor 3 reported she is the home supervisor for the unit,
and she received a call from Staff 1 stating she just got into a fight
with Youth A. Staff 1 told Supervisor 3 she “had to hit [Youth A] in
order to get [Youth A] off her”. Supervisor 3 hung up with Staff 1
and made calls to other points of authority and on call therapist
since this situation was considered a critical incident. Supervisor 3
reported she talked to Youth A over the phone, and Youth A said
her nails were hurt, Staff 1 pulled her hair, and she didn’t know if
she was okay. Supervisor 3 reported Youth A was taken to the
hospital to be assessed. Supervisor 3 reported she called Staff 1
later in the evening to check on her and let her know an
investigation would occur regarding the incident. Supervisor 3
reported Staff 1 told her she went to the hospital because she was
hyperventilating and was throwing up. Supervisor 3 reported she
has never received any complaints about Staff 1’s interactions
with youth prior to this incident. Supervisor 3 reported Youth A’s
phone calls with her mom have always been supervised, so she
doesn’t know why there would be any confusion regarding
whether the calls could be supervised or unsupervised.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 12/6/24. Staff 3 reported
Youth A came out of the TV room and asked Staff 1 to call her
mom. Staff 3 reported when Youth A entered the TV room, she
had a crop top and leggings on, but she had put on a sweatshirt
on by the time she came out of the TV room. Staff 3 reported she
didn’t see anything wrong with Youth A’s outfit because the
sweatshirt was longer. Staff 3 reported she could not hear Staff
1’s response to Youth A’s request. Staff 3 reported she went into
the staff office to do training, and a short while later heard a verbal
altercation occurring in the milieu. Staff 3 reported when she came
out of the office, she heard Youth A repeatedly asked Staff 1 to
stop talking to her, but Staff 1 kept saying little things to Youth A
and would not stop talking to her. Staff 3 reported Youth A got in
Staff 1’s face and told Staff 1 to stop talking to her.
10

Staff 3 reported something happened between Youth A getting in
Staff 1’s face and the initial punch, but she couldn’t see what it
was. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Youth A were both punching
each other, and neither of them were backing down. Staff 3
reported at one point, Staff 2 was able to get Staff 1 into the staff
office, but Youth A pushed past Staff 2 and began assaulting Staff
1 again. Staff 3 reported she was a new staff and could not
physically intervene in the fight by restraining Youth A because
she had not yet been trained in their restraint model. Staff 3
reported Staff 2 got in between Staff 1 and Youth A to intervene
and try to separate them, but Youth A kept finding her way back to
assault Staff 1. Staff 3 reported even though Youth A was more
aggressive and kept finding her way back to fight Staff 1, she fully
believed Youth A was triggered by Staff 1, and it could have been
avoided. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 should have stopped talking to
Youth A after the multiple times Youth A asked her to, and
because Staff 1 didn’t stop, Staff 3 felt like Staff 1 completely
instigated the situation. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 had a “stand my
ground” mentality and wouldn’t quit. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 never
walked away, tried to get another staff involved, or tried to de-
escalate the situation like she should have. Staff 3 reported even
after Youth A tried to talk to Staff 2 about calling her mom, Staff 1
kept injecting herself into the conversation and wouldn’t walk
away.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 10/26/24 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have any audio. Youth A was wearing a long
sleeve cropped shirt and a pair of yoga pants. Youth A did not
have any skin showing as the crop top was flush with the top of
her pants. Youth A enters the milieu and goes over to the kitchen
window. Youth B, Youth C and Youth D are in the milieu by the
TV. Staff 2 is in the kitchen and Staff 1 is standing by the kitchen
window. Youth A walks over to the staff desk and Staff 1 follows
her. Youth A kneels on a chair by the staff desk. Youth A and Staff
1 exchange words. Staff 1 begins walking away but comes back
and talks to Youth A again. Youth A turns her head away from
Staff 1 and Staff 1 continues talking. Youth A gets off the chair,
turns around, and it is clear she is upset based on her hand
movements and body language. They continue exchanging words.
Youth A walks away, around the tables to avoid Staff 1, and walks
to the kitchen window. Youth A begins talking to Staff 2 in the
kitchen window and Staff 1 approaches them. Staff 1 begins
talking, and Youth A takes a step away from Staff 1. Youth A
walks away from the kitchen window towards the staff desk. Staff
11

2 exits the kitchen and enters the staff office. Youth A kneels on
the chair by the staff desk again. Staff 1 begins walking away from
the kitchen window and starts talking to Youth A when she gets
about halfway between the kitchen window and the staff desk.
Youth A gets off the chair and she appears upset by the way she
is slapping her hands together and facing Staff 1. Youth A begins
walking towards Staff 1 and stops when she is approximately 6
feet away from her. They continue exchanging words. Youth A
then walks away and back towards the staff office. Staff 2 is still in
the staff office.
Youth A is pacing and waiting by the staff office. Staff 1 is still
talking to Youth A. Youth A picks up two things from the staff desk
and throws them at Staff 1. Youth A then approaches Staff 1 while
smacking her hands together. When Youth A is approximately 1-2
feet away from Staff 1, Staff 1 holds out her arm to block Youth A,
and Youth A pushes Staff 1’s arm away. Youth A steps a couple
feet back and Staff 1 steps a couple feet towards Youth A. Staff 1
begins to walk past Youth A and Youth A pushes Staff 1’s arm,
while Staff 1 is trying to pass by.
Staff 2 comes out of the staff office. Youth A punches Staff 1 in
the face as Staff 2 approaches them. Staff 1 returns the punch
and they both begin punching each other. Staff 1 grabs a hold of
